Game Rules 

Bases: 

One Cachito is a bolivian dice game called "cacho alalay". 

At each round, 1 to 3 players (single or 2-players teams) roll dices, to obtain combinations of numbers, that they score on the notebook. 

During each turn, a player rolls dices to perform an intent. An intent is made of 1 or 2 roll dice trials. The first trial is always performed with 5 dices; if the player obtained a "de mano" result (see below), he may score inmediatly. 

If he does not obtained a "de mano" result, or if he chooses not to score, he should put back 1 to 5 dices into the tumbler, and roll dices a second trial. In case of a second trial, the player should turn over at least 1 dice, and optionaly a second dice, and then score. 

Note: if a player chooses to put back the 5 dices into the tumbler, the result obtained in the second trial could also be considered "de mano". 

Each player can consult the scoring notebook on any time to make decisions about next trials, simply pushing his/her name on rigth bottom corner.

1. No player have a chance to continue scoring : all cases in the notebook are filled. The winner is the player that score the higher number, summing all points. 

2. A player scores "dormida": if during a trial, all dices show the same number, this player wins the game. 

3. A player scores "panza de oro": if a player scores all 3 in line (straight, full, poker) with "de mano" results, and had at least scored one five-of-a-kind (yahtzee), he wins the game. 

4. A player that scores a four-of-a-kind or five-of-a-kind in all "alay" cases (one, two, three, four, five, six), and scores at leat a five-of-a-kind, he wins the game."
\n\nEach player has a notebook to score the results:

De mano: a result is considered "de mano" if it's the direct result of rolling the 5 dices, without any turn over. You may score "de mano" the following results: 

"de mano straight" , "de mano full" , "de mano poker" and the "dormida".

De huevo: a result is considered "de huevo" if it requires a turn over of 1 or 2 dices for scoring. You may score "de huevo" the following results: 

"de huevo straight" ,"de huevo full" , "de huevo poker" and "de huevo five-of-a-kind".
\n\nErasing: when you erase a case, with a cross, it means that you scored 0 points.

Each case can be scored only once. When a player or team has no option to score any result (including posible turning over dices), he/it has to choose which case to erase with a cross (which means 0 points).
